javadoc:
VertexSet is a container class for objects of type Vertex. It is
 designed to be used in conjunction with EdgeSet as part of DirectedGraph.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor

params.name: parent
params.comment: The DirectedGraph this is a VertexSet of.

params.name: capacity
params.comment: number of vertices that may be held without invoking grow()

methods.name: index
methods.comment: Return the internal index of the given vertex within this edge set.

methods.name: add
methods.comment:
Adds the given vertex to the vertex set, if it does not already contain
 it.

return.comment: true if and only if the vertex was sucessfully added.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given vertex from this vertex set if it contains it.
@return true if and only if the vertex was sucessfully removed.
methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Removes the given vertex from this vertex set if it contains it.

return.comment: true if and only if the vertex was sucessfully removed.

methods.javadoc: Return The number of vertices in this VertexSet.
methods.name: size
methods.comment: Return The number of vertices in this VertexSet.

methods.javadoc:
Return true iff the specified KeyedObject is contained in
 this VertexSet.
methods.name: contains
methods.comment:
Return true iff the specified KeyedObject is contained in
 this VertexSet.

methods.javadoc: Return the Vertex at the specified index. May be null.
methods.name: getByIndex
methods.comment: Return the Vertex at the specified index. May be null.

methods.javadoc:
Return the number of sources.
 This equals the number of vertices with no incoming
 edges in the VertexSet.
methods.name: numSources
methods.comment:
Return the number of sources.
 This equals the number of vertices with no incoming
 edges in the VertexSet.

methods.javadoc:
Return the number of sinks.  
 This equals the number of vertices with no outgoing
 edges in the VertexSet.
methods.name: numSinks
methods.comment:
Return the number of sinks.  
 This equals the number of vertices with no outgoing
 edges in the VertexSet.

methods.javadoc:
Return a Vertex[] containing all vertices in the VertexSet that
 have no incoming edges. If there are none an array of length 0 
 will be returned.
methods.name: getSources
methods.comment:
Return a Vertex[] containing all vertices in the VertexSet that
 have no incoming edges. If there are none an array of length 0 
 will be returned.

methods.javadoc:
Return a Vertex[] containing all vertices in the VertexSet that
 have no outgoing edges. If there are none an array of length 0 
 will be returned.
methods.name: getSinks
methods.comment:
Return a Vertex[] containing all vertices in the VertexSet that
 have no outgoing edges. If there are none an array of length 0 
 will be returned.

methods.javadoc:
Get the first outgoing edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.
methods.name: getFirstOutgoingEdge
methods.comment:
Get the first outgoing edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.

methods.javadoc:
Get the last outgoing edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.
methods.name: getLastOutgoingEdge
methods.comment:
Get the last outgoing edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.

methods.javadoc:
Get the first incoming edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.
methods.name: getFirstIncomingEdge
methods.comment:
Get the first incoming edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.

methods.javadoc:
Get the last incoming edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.
methods.name: getLastIncomingEdge
methods.comment:
Get the last incoming edge in the internal structures for this 
 VertexSet for the parent DirectedGraph.

methods.javadoc:
Set the first outgoing edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.
methods.name: setFirstOutgoingEdge
methods.comment:
Set the first outgoing edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.

methods.javadoc:
Set the last outgoing edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.
methods.name: setLastOutgoingEdge
methods.comment:
Set the last outgoing edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.

methods.javadoc:
Set the first incoming edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.
methods.name: setFirstIncomingEdge
methods.comment:
Set the first incoming edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.

methods.javadoc:
Set the last incoming edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.
methods.name: setLastIncomingEdge
methods.comment:
Set the last incoming edge of v to be e. 
 It is assumed that v has already been added to the graph.

methods.javadoc:
Remove all of the vertices from this VertexSet without changing
 the capacity. Much faster than removing each vertex individually.
 The EdgeSet for this graph gets cleared first.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment:
Remove all of the vertices from this VertexSet without changing
 the capacity. Much faster than removing each vertex individually.
 The EdgeSet for this graph gets cleared first.

methods.javadoc: Return the number of vertices this VertexSet may hold without growing.
methods.name: capacity
methods.comment: Return the number of vertices this VertexSet may hold without growing.

methods.javadoc:
Increases the capacity of the VertexSet so additional vertices
 can be added.
methods.name: grow
methods.comment:
Increases the capacity of the VertexSet so additional vertices
 can be added.

methods.javadoc: Clean up the internal storage of the VertexSet.
methods.name: tighten
methods.comment: Clean up the internal storage of the VertexSet.

methods.javadoc: Get the number of times this VertexSet has changed
methods.name: getModificationNumber
methods.comment: Get the number of times this VertexSet has changed

methods.javadoc:
Return an iterator over all of the vertices in this VertexSet.
 The iterator becomes invalid and throws a ConcurrentModificationException
 if any changes are made to the VertexSet after the iterator is created.
methods.name: iterator
methods.comment:
Return an iterator over all of the vertices in this VertexSet.
 The iterator becomes invalid and throws a ConcurrentModificationException
 if any changes are made to the VertexSet after the iterator is created.

methods.javadoc: Return the elements of this VertexSet as a java.util.Set.
methods.name: toSet
methods.comment: Return the elements of this VertexSet as a java.util.Set.

methods.javadoc: Return the elements of this VertexSet as an Vertex[].
methods.name: toArray
methods.comment: Return the elements of this VertexSet as an Vertex[].

name: VertexSet
comment:
VertexSet is a container class for objects of type Vertex. It is
 designed to be used in conjunction with EdgeSet as part of DirectedGraph.
